``` {r darkmode, echo = FALSE}
theme_darkmode <- function(bg ="#000000", primary="#FFFFFF", secondary="#888888"){ # create Theme
  theme_gray() %+replace%
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = "montserrat"),
    # axis.title.y = element_text(color = secondary, angle=90),
    # axis.title.x = element_text(color = secondary, angle=90),
    axis.text = element_text(color=secondary, size=rel(0.8)),
    axis.ticks = element_blank(),
    legend.text = element_text(color=primary, size=rel(0.8)),
    panel.grid.major = element_line(color =secondary, size=0.25),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    panel.background = element_rect(fill=bg, color=NA),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill=bg, color=NA),
    legend.background = element_rect(fill=bg, color=NA),
    legend.key = element_rect(fill = bg, color = NA)
  )
}
```

## Currencies exchage rates

The plot below shows how much of differents currencies could be bought on average for 1 US dollar throughout years.

```{r currencies, echo = FALSE,  include = FALSE}
curr <- data.frame(read.csv("Data pack/CurrencyExchangeRates.csv")) # read Data

curr <- curr %>%  select(Date, Euro, Polish.Zloty) %>% # tidy Data up
  replace(is.na(.), 0) %>%
  filter(Euro > 0 & Polish.Zloty > 0) %>%
  mutate(year = format(as.Date(Date), '%Y'), month = format(as.Date(Date), '%m')) %>%
  group_by(month, year) %>%
  summarise_at(vars(Euro, Polish.Zloty), list(mean)) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols=c(Euro, Polish.Zloty), names_to = "currency", values_to = "rate") %>%
  mutate( Ym = as.Date(paste(year, month, 01), "%Y %m %d"))
head(curr)
```

```{r currecies_plot, echo = FALSE}
ggplot(curr, aes(x = Ym, y = rate, color = currency, group=currency)) + # make plot
  geom_line() +
  labs(title="One USD in different currecies",
    x = "Year", y = "",
    color = "") +
  theme_darkmode(bg = "#222222", secondary = "#e5f5f9") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1),
    legend.position = "top",
    title = element_text(colour = "#ffffbf")) +
  scale_color_manual(values=c('#91bfdb','#fc8d59')) +
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 year", date_labels = "%Y")
```

It cab be clearly seen that Euro was much more stable than Polish Zloty.


## Gold prices

Here we can see how the price of gold changed in different currecies throughout years.

```{r gold, echo = FALSE,  include = FALSE}
gold <- data.frame(read.csv("Data pack/Gold prices.csv")) # read Data

gold <- gold %>% 
  replace(is.na(.), 0) %>%
  filter_all(all_vars(. > 0)) %>%
  mutate(USD = paste(USD..AM., USD..PM.),
         GBR = paste(GBP..AM., GBP..PM.),
         EURO = paste(EURO..AM., EURO..PM.), 
         .keep="unused") %>%
  pivot_longer(cols=c(USD, GBR, EURO), names_to = "currency", values_to = "AMPM") %>%
  separate(AMPM, c("AM", "PM"), sep = " ", remove = TRUE) %>%
  mutate(diff = abs(1 - as.numeric(AM)/as.numeric(PM)), avg = (as.numeric(AM)+as.numeric(PM))/2) %>%
  mutate(year = format(as.Date(Date), '%Y'), month = format(as.Date(Date), '%m')) %>%
  group_by(month, year, currency) %>%
  summarise_at(vars(diff, avg), list(mean)) %>%
  mutate(Date = as.Date(paste(year, month, 01), "%Y %m %d"))
head(gold)
```

```{r gold_plot, echo = FALSE}
# ggplot(gold, aes(x = Date, y = avg, fill = currency)) + # make plot
#   geom_bar(position="stack", stat="identity")

ggplot(gold, aes(x = Date, y = avg, fill = diff*100)) + # make plot
  geom_bar(stat="identity") +
  facet_grid(currency ~ .) +
  theme_darkmode(bg = "#222222", secondary = "#e5f5f9") +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1),
    legend.position = "bottom",
    title = element_text(colour = "#ffffbf"),
    strip.text.y.right = element_text(angle = 90)) +
  labs(title="Gold prices",
    x = "Year", y = "Average price") +
  scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 year", date_labels = "%Y") +
  scale_fill_gradient(name = "Average daily\ndifference in %   ",
                      low = "#4575b4", high = "#d73027", 
                      limits = c(0, 2), breaks = c(0, 1, 2))
```

In all the currecies the prices have been following similar pattern in both average price and daily difference.
